contentrichtext.text: {{Orphan|date=March 2011}} '''Aufidius''' is the [[Roman naming conventions|nomen]] of the Roman ''[[gens]]'' [[Aufidia (gens)|Aufidia]]''. * Gnaeus Aufidius Orestes, consul 71 BC * Marcus [[Aufidius Lurco]], a magistrate and maternal grandfather to [[Ancient Rome|Roman]] [[Empress]] [[Livia]] Drusilla * [[Aufidius Bassus]], historian * Publius Iuuentius Celsus T. Aufidius Hoenius Seuerianus, consul 129 * Lucius Aufidius Pantera, prefect who dedicated an altar now at [[Lympne]], [[Kent]], England [http://www.roman-britain.org/places/portus_lemanis.htm] * Gaius Aufidius Victorinus, consul 183 * Marcus Aufidius Fronto, consul 199 * Gaius Aufidius Victorinus, consul 200 * Gaius Aufidius Marcellus, consul 226 == Fiction == '''Tullus Aufidius''' is a major character in the [[tragedy]] of ''[[Coriolanus (play)|Coriolanus]]'' by [[William Shakespeare]]. [[Category:Ancient Roman families]] [[Category:Prosopography of Ancient Rome]]
